titlestmt.titleproper: Finding Aid for the C. F. Peters Collection of Morton Feldman Manuscripts, 1961-1969
Peters (C.F.) Collection of Morton Feldman Manuscripts
titlestmt.author: Finding aid written by John Bewley.

publicationstmt.publisher: State University of New York at Buffalo. Music Library
publicationstmt.p: © 2008. State University of New York at Buffalo. All rights reserved.

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded in EAD by John Bewley, October 2008.

did.head: Collection Overview
did.unittitle: C. F. Peters Collection of Morton Feldman Manuscripts, 1961-1969
did.langmaterial: No textual materials are included in the collection.

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: State University of New York at Buffalo. Music Library

did.abstract: The collection consists of 79 works by Morton Feldman in either score or part formats (72 scores; 7 sets of parts). All but one item are ink manuscripts on vellum. These served as the masters that Feldman submitted to C. F. Peters and Peters published directly from these masters. Almost all of the manuscripts are in Morton Feldman's hand, except for two scores copied by John Cage and three items in the hand of a music copyist.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Specified item], C. F. Peters Collection of Morton Feldman Manuscripts, 1961-1969, Music Library, The State University of New York at Buffalo.

accessrestrict.head: Terms of Access
accessrestrict.p: Materials can be examined by qualified researchers in the Music Library during hours of operation during which Music Librarians are present. In order to insure access, researchers are advised to contact the Music Library in advance of visits.

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: Copyright for the materials in the collection does not reside with the Music Library. Therefore, patrons wishing to publish any item, or part of an item from this collection for any purpose, are responsible for securing requisite permissions.

accruals.head: Accruals and Additions
accruals.p: No further accruals are expected to this collection.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Composer Morton Feldman (1926-1987) was best known for his association with the New York School of experimentalist musicians, including composers John Cage, Christian Wolff, and Earle Brown, and pianist David Tudor. In addition to composing approximately 150 works, Feldman also wrote more than three dozen articles about various aspects of music and art.

Feldman was a member of the music department faculty at the State University of New York at Buffalo 1972-1987. During those years he served as Slee Professor of Music 1972-1973, Edgar Varèse Professor 1975-1987, and Director of the Center of the Creative and Performing Arts, 1976-1980. He was also responsible for creating the June in Buffalo festival of contemporary music in 1975.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of 79 works by Morton Feldman in either score or part formats (72 scores; 7 sets of parts). All but one item are ink manuscripts on vellum. These served as the masters that Feldman submitted to C. F. Peters and Peters published directly from these masters. Almost all of the manuscripts are in Morton Feldman's hand, except for two scores copied by John Cage and three items in the hand of a music copyist. Some items are accompanied by the folders in which they were housed at C. F. Peters. The folders contain brief information about number of copies created and instructions for printing parts. As such, the collection provides a history of the music publishing process rather than anything about the musical genesis of the works. The original manuscripts for the works in the collection, if extant, are housed in the Paul Sacher Stiftung in Basel, Switzerland.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Compositions by Morton Feldman. Arranged in numerical order by C. F. Peters publisher numbers.
Arranged in numerical order by C. F. Peters publisher numbers.

Peters Corporation, 373 Park Ave. South, New York, N.Y."--Label pasted on bottom of leaf 1. "Edition Peters 6968"--Label pasted on bottom of leaf 1.

Holograph (Ink, vellum master). Caption title. For 2 violins, 3 violoncellos, 2 contrabasses, 2 flute, 2 tubas, trombone, horn, harp, 4 pianos, 2 percussions. At end of score: 1966/1967 (Oct.). Includes typescript performance instructions (1 leaf ; 28 cm.) inside wrapper marked "Old, do not use." "Copyright 1967 by C.F. Peters Corp., 373 Park Ave. So., N.Y. 16, N.Y."--Bottom of leaf 1. Assigned publisher's number 6969 upon publication by Peters.

Holograph (Ink, vellum masters). Caption title. For 2 violins, 3 violoncellos, 2 contrabasses, 2 flute, 2 tubas, trombone, horn, harp, 4 pianos, 2 percussions. Parts are condensed scores for instrumental groups: movement one has three groups, movement 2 has four groups. Includes two typescript copies of performance instructions (1 leaf ea. ; 28 cm.). "Copyright 1967 by C.F. Peters Corporation, 373 Park Ave. South, N.Y. 16, N.Y."--Bottom of leaf 1. Assigned publisher's number 6969 upon publication by Peters.

unittitle.title: False relationships and the extended ending : cello, violin, trombone, 3 pianos, chimes

scopecontent.p: Holograph (Ink, vellum master). Includes typescript performance instructions on t.p. (1 leaf ; 28 cm.). "Copyright 1968 by C.F. Peters Corporation, 373 Park Ave. South, New York, N.Y."--Bottom of leaf 1. Assigned publisher's number 6970 upon publication by Peters.

unittitle.title: False relationships and the extended ending : cello, violin, trombone, 3 pianos, chimes

scopecontent.p: Holograph (Ink, vellum masters). Caption title. Parts are condensed scores for instrumental groups: Group 1: violin, trombone, piano; Group 2: cello, 2 pianos, chimes. Includes typescript performance instructions (1 leaf ; 28 cm.) attached to each parts group. "Copyright 1968 by C.F. Peters Corporation, 373 Park Ave. South, New York, N.Y."--Bottom of leaf 1. Assigned publisher's number 6970a upon publication by Peters.

unittitle.title: Between categories : piano, chimes, violin, violoncello (2 of each instrument)

scopecontent.p: Holograph (Ink, vellum master). Includes instructions for performance on t.p. At end of score: Feb. 9, 1969. "Copyright 1969 by C.F. Peters Corporation, 373 Park Ave. South, New York, N.Y. "--Bottom of leaf 1. Assigned publisher's number 6971 upon publication by Peters.

note.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the Library's online catalog.

otherfindaid.head: Additional Guides
otherfindaid.p: All scores in the collection are cataloged in WorldCat and are available in BISON, the online catalog for the University at Buffalo Libraries, by performing a "Title begins with" search under "C F Peters collection of morton feldman manuscripts".

relatedmaterial.head: Related Resources in the Music Library

defitem.label: Morton Feldman Papers, 1950-1999 Mus. Arc. 2.1
defitem.item: Predominantly secondary materials, including eight boxes of programs and clippings, two boxes of Feldman's published writings, and another box of writings for or about Feldman. Other than a small number of musical fragments, it contains none of Feldman's scores, printed or manuscript.

defitem.label: Morton Feldman Images by Jan Williams, 1974-1979 Mus. Arc. 2.3
defitem.item: A digitized collection of 56 images of Feldman taken by percussionist Jan Williams during European concert tours in 1974, 1977, and 1979.
